NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Thousands of city cops will soon carry a life-saving drug that will help prevent heroin overdoses, officials said Tuesday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In the coming weeks, 20,000 cops — more than half of the entire NYPD — will be carrying doses of Naloxone, Police Commissioner Bill Bratton and state Attorney General Eric Schneiderman announced. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Naloxone is a nasal spray that helps revive victims suffering from a heroin or prescription drug overdose. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mark Bonifacio/New York Daily News The 20,000 NYPD will carry Naloxone to help prevent heroin overdoses. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “You cannot prosecute yourself out of a drug epidemic,” Schneiderman said after announcing that he will be spending $1 million to provide the NYPD with the drug, nasal injectors and the training needed to utilize the drug. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The money will come from money collected in drug forfeiture cases, which Bratton called an “ironic” and “creative” way to use the seized funds.
